key_points: President Joe Biden toured flood damage in New Jersey and planned a visit to New York City to survey Hurricane Ida's aftermath.
Biden emphasized the impact of climate change on extreme weather and called for urgent action.
He has approved major disaster declarations for affected counties in New Jersey and New York, enabling federal aid.
Hurricane Ida hit Louisiana as a Category 4 storm and caused devastating floods as it moved northeast.
Biden's visit aims to push for federal spending on infrastructure to better defend against future storms.
The president highlighted the increasing frequency of extreme weather across the country due to climate change.
Over 50 people were killed in six eastern states due to record rainfall from the remnants of Hurricane Ida.
New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy indicated that clean-up and rebuilding would take months.
Biden previously visited Louisiana to assess damages from Hurricane Ida's initial landfall.
White House spokeswoman Jen Psaki highlighted the widespread impact of severe weather across the US.
